name: SID 0x2A ReadDataByPeriodicIdentifier - Comprehensive Test Suite
description: Production-grade test suite for UDS Service ID 0x2A (ReadDataByPeriodicIdentifier) based on ISO 14229-1:2020 Section 11.2. Covers all positive/negative response conditions, transmission modes, session/security validation, service interactions, and error recovery scenarios.

requests.description: [SETUP] Reset to Default Session
TC-01: Request in DEFAULT Session - Expect NRC 0x22 (Conditions Not Correct)
[SETUP] Enter PROGRAMMING Session for TC-02
TC-02: Request in PROGRAMMING Session - Expect NRC 0x22 (Conditions Not Correct)
[SETUP] Enter EXTENDED Session for TC-03
TC-03: Request in EXTENDED Session - Expect Positive Response (0x6A)
TC-03.1: Stop All Transmissions (cleanup)
TC-04: Start Periodic TX before session change
TC-04.1: Change to DEFAULT Session - Periodic TX should stop
[SETUP] Return to EXTENDED for TC-05
TC-05: Start Periodic TX before session change to PROGRAMMING
TC-05.1: Change to PROGRAMMING Session - Periodic TX should stop
[SETUP] Enter EXTENDED Session for Transmission Mode Tests
TC-10: Mode 0x00 (Reserved) - Expect NRC 0x12 (Sub-Function Not Supported)
TC-11: Mode 0x01 (Slow Rate) with PDID 0x01 - Expect Positive Response
TC-11.1: Stop All (cleanup)
TC-12: Mode 0x02 (Medium Rate) with PDID 0x01 - Expect Positive Response
TC-12.1: Stop All (cleanup)
TC-13: Mode 0x03 (Fast Rate) with PDID 0x01 - Expect Positive Response
TC-14: Mode 0x04 (Stop Sending) - Expect Positive Response
TC-15: Mode 0x05 (Invalid) - Expect NRC 0x12
TC-16: Mode 0x7F (Max without suppress bit) - Expect NRC 0x12
TC-17: Mode 0xFF (Max value) - Expect NRC 0x12
TC-20: Missing Sub-function (only SID) - Expect NRC 0x13 (Incorrect Message Length)
TC-21: Mode 0x02 without PDID - Expect NRC 0x13 (Incorrect Message Length)
TC-22: Mode 0x04 alone (Stop All - no PDID required) - Expect Positive Response
TC-24: Single PDID request (minimal valid) - Expect Positive Response
TC-24.1: Stop All (cleanup)
TC-30: Valid PDID 0x01 (Engine RPM) - Expect Positive Response
TC-30.1: Stop All
TC-31: Valid PDID 0x02 (Vehicle Speed) - Expect Positive Response
TC-31.1: Stop All
TC-32: Valid PDID 0x03 (Coolant Temp) - Expect Positive Response
TC-32.1: Stop All
TC-33: Valid PDID 0x04 (MAF) - Expect Positive Response
TC-33.1: Stop All
TC-34: Invalid PDID 0x00 - Expect NRC 0x31 (Request Out Of Range)
TC-35: Invalid PDID 0x99 - Expect NRC 0x31 (Request Out Of Range)
TC-36: Invalid PDID 0xFF - Expect NRC 0x31 (Request Out Of Range)
TC-37: Multiple valid PDIDs (0x01, 0x02, 0x03) in single request - Expect Positive Response
TC-37.1: Stop All (cleanup)
TC-40: Protected PDID 0x0A while LOCKED - Expect NRC 0x33 (Security Access Denied)
TC-41: Security Access - Request Seed
TC-42: Security Access - Send Key (correct key)
TC-43: Protected PDID 0x0A while UNLOCKED - Expect Positive Response
TC-43.1: Stop All
[SETUP] Re-enter EXTENDED (re-locks security) for TC-44
TC-44: Mix of public (0x01) + protected (0x0A) while locked - Expect NRC 0x33
TC-45.1: Unlock - Request Seed
TC-45.2: Unlock - Send Key (correct key)
TC-45: Mix of public (0x01) + protected (0x0A) while unlocked - Expect Positive Response
TC-45.3: Stop All
[SETUP] TC-50: Enter EXTENDED Session - TesterPresent Interaction Test
TC-50.1: Start Periodic TX (PDID 0x01)
TC-50.2: TesterPresent at T+2s (suppress response)
TC-51.1: TesterPresent at T+4s
TC-51.2: TesterPresent at T+6s (session maintained)
TC-52: Verify Session Active (Read DID F186) - Session should be maintained
TC-52.1: Stop All Transmissions
[SETUP] TC-60: Enter EXTENDED Session - ECU Reset Interaction Test
TC-60.1: Start Periodic TX
TC-61: ECU Hard Reset (0x11 0x01) - Aborts all periodic TX
TC-62: Re-enter EXTENDED Session after reset
TC-63: Re-request Periodic Data - Expect Positive Response
TC-63.1: Stop All
[SETUP] TC-70: Enter EXTENDED Session - Session Control Interaction Test
TC-70.1: Start Periodic TX in EXTENDED
TC-71: Session Change to DEFAULT - TX should stop
TC-72: Request in DEFAULT Session - Expect NRC 0x22
TC-73: Return to EXTENDED Session
TC-74: Re-request Periodic Data - Expect Positive Response
TC-75.1: Stop All Transmissions
TC-75.2: Return to DEFAULT Session (cleanup)
[SETUP] TC-80: Enter EXTENDED Session - Multiple Rate Monitoring Test
TC-80: Request PDID 0x01 at Slow Rate (0x01)
TC-81: Request PDID 0x02 at Medium Rate (0x02)
TC-82: Request PDID 0x03 at Fast Rate (0x03)
TC-83: Verify All Three Rates Active (Read DID F186 to confirm session)
TC-84: Stop All Transmissions
TC-85: Verify All Stopped (session still active via DID read)
[SETUP] TC-90: Enter EXTENDED Session - Error Recovery Test
TC-90.1: Invalid Request (Mode 0x05) - Expect NRC 0x12
TC-90.2: Valid Request After Error - Expect Positive Response
TC-90.3: Stop All
TC-91: Session Survives Rejected Request (Read DID F186)
TC-92.1: Wrong PDID 0x99 - Expect NRC 0x31
TC-92.2: Correct PDID 0x01 after error - Expect Positive Response
TC-92.3: Stop All
TC-93.1: Protected PDID 0x0A while locked - Expect NRC 0x33
TC-93.2: Unlock - Request Seed
TC-93.3: Unlock - Send Key (correct key)
TC-93.4: Protected PDID 0x0A now works - Expect Positive Response
TC-94: Scheduler Recovery - Stop All
TC-94.1: New Request After Stop - Expect Positive Response
TC-94.2: Final Stop
[FINAL] TC-95: Reset to DEFAULT Session - Test Suite Complete

metadata.author: UDS Simulator
metadata.description: ISO 14229-1:2020 Section 11.2 compliant production-grade test suite for SID 0x2A (ReadDataByPeriodicIdentifier). Based on comprehensive analysis of SID_2A_PRACTICAL_IMPLEMENTATION.md, SID_2A_READ_DATA_BY_PERIODIC_IDENTIFIER.md, SID_2A_SERVICE_INTERACTIONS.md, and SID_2A_VERIFICATION.md.
testCategories: Service Interactions - ECU Reset (TC-60 to TC-63)
Service Interactions - Session Control (TC-70 to TC-75)

notes: Test Suite v2.0.0: Comprehensive production-grade coverage for SID 0x2A. Tests 10 categories: (1) Session validation - DEFAULT/PROGRAMMING fail with NRC 0x22, EXTENDED succeeds. (2) Transmission modes 0x01-0x04 valid, 0x00/0x05+/0x7F/0xFF fail with NRC 0x12. (3) Message length - missing sub-function or PDID fails with NRC 0x13. (4) PDID validation - 0x01-0x04 valid, 0x00/0x99/0xFF fail with NRC 0x31. (5) Security - PDID 0x0A requires unlock, fails with NRC 0x33 when locked. (6) TesterPresent integration - maintains session during periodic TX. (7) ECU Reset aborts all periodic TX. (8) Session changes abort all periodic TX. (9) Multiple rates can operate simultaneously. (10) Error recovery - session survives rejected requests.

testCaseDetails.TC-01-TC-05: Session validation - only EXTENDED session (0x03) allows SID 0x2A. DEFAULT and PROGRAMMING return NRC 0x22. Session changes stop all active periodic transmissions.
testCaseDetails.TC-10-TC-17: Transmission mode validation covering all 4 valid modes (0x01 Slow, 0x02 Medium, 0x03 Fast, 0x04 Stop) and invalid modes (0x00, 0x05, 0x7F, 0xFF) returning NRC 0x12.
testCaseDetails.TC-20-TC-24: Message length validation - missing sub-function returns NRC 0x13. Mode 0x01-0x03 require at least one PDID. Mode 0x04 (Stop) can be sent without PDID.
testCaseDetails.TC-30-TC-37: PDID validation - PDIDs 0x01-0x04 are valid (mapped to DIDs). PDID 0x00, 0x99, 0xFF are invalid and return NRC 0x31. Multiple PDIDs can be requested in single message.
testCaseDetails.TC-40-TC-45: Security validation - PDID 0x0A requires security unlock. Returns NRC 0x33 when locked. After SID 0x27 unlock, protected PDIDs become accessible.
testCaseDetails.TC-50-TC-52: TesterPresent (0x3E) integration - periodic transmission continues indefinitely when session kept alive. Session timeout prevention verified.
testCaseDetails.TC-60-TC-63: ECU Reset (0x11) interaction - hard reset aborts all periodic transmissions. After reset, must re-enter EXTENDED session and re-request periodic data.
testCaseDetails.TC-70-TC-75: Session control interaction - changing session (EXTENDED→DEFAULT or EXTENDED→PROGRAMMING) stops all periodic transmissions. Must be re-requested.
testCaseDetails.TC-80-TC-85: Multiple rate monitoring - three PDIDs at Slow, Medium, and Fast rates active simultaneously. Verifies scheduler handles interleaved transmissions.
testCaseDetails.TC-90-TC-95: Error recovery - session survives rejected requests. Invalid mode, invalid PDID, and security denied errors do not corrupt scheduler state.
